Energy Efficient CHP co-generation

CHP is an energy efficient technology that generates electricity and captures the heat that would otherwise be wasted to provide useful thermal energy-such as steam of hot water that can be used for space heating, cooling, domestic hot water and industrial processes. CHP can be located at an individual facility or building, or be a district energy or utility resource. CHP is typically located at facilities where there is a need for both electricity and thermal energy.

Industries/Building

OTAE controls has set the standard in the industry for innovative, const-effective, and truly open building and energy management systems that help increased operation savings and sustainability throughout the life-cycle of industrial facilities. Our commitment to open protocols, industry and IT standards, combined with our best of breed to reach LEED certified industry or complex.
